title: KOSPI Index Climbs With AI Optimism Despite Friday's Drop
text:
about 1 hour ago • 1 min
Find out what happened in the markets today – and why you should care – with the free Daily Brief newsletter.
What’s going on here?
South Korea’s KOSPI index rode a wave of AI optimism to a strong week, led by standout performances from Hyundai and SK Hynix, despite a slight dip on Friday.
What does this mean?
The KOSPI index notched its best week in two months with a 2.9% rise, even with a 0.24% slip on Friday, closing at 2,515.89. This boost came from SK Hynix, which saw [stock](/glossary/stock) gains through advancing chip development for Nvidia. Hyundai Motor's AI partnership with Nvidia also lifted spirits, reflecting positively on Kia’s shares. In contrast, LG Energy Solution and its rivals Samsung SDI and SK Innovation faced declines due to an expected operating loss in the fourth quarter. Despite foreign investors shedding 11.7 billion won in shares, local belief in tech innovation kept spirits high.
Why should I care?
For markets: AI optimism dominates despite market jitters.
Investors showed caution on Friday, causing declines in 499 of the 942 traded stocks as they digested different corporate outcomes and economic reports. Yet, Hyundai and SK Hynix’s AI advancements helped the KOSPI excel over the week. These shifts suggest growth potential in AI and tech, despite market flux and external sell-offs.
The bigger picture: Korea eyes economic stability amid tech growth.
With AI spearheading KOSPI’s charge, the Korean government is keen on economic steadiness, vigilantly watching the financial markets for disturbances or intervention needs. These efforts occur as the won slightly strengthens against the US dollar, indicating Korea’s readiness to bolster its market while embracing tech advancements and global economic changes.
